intro: Physaria didymocarpa var. newberryi, commonly known as the Newberry's bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces distinctive inflated, seed-containing pods that resemble small bladders, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. The species is characterized by its compact growth habit and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring.
